title: 104_hr3117
content: AUTHORITY TO ESTABLISH AND OPERATE MANAGED HEALTH-CARE PLANS. Establishment of managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code allows the Secretary to operate these plans through Department health-care facilities or other entities for the delivery of health services. The Secretary can establish managed health care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code through Department facilities or other entities. These plans must meet standards set by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services. Minimum health care benefits for veterans enrolled in the plan must include benefits covered under Medicare parts A and B. The Secretary may establish an enrollment system for veterans to enroll in managed health care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. Cost-sharing requirements can be set by the Secretary to cover additional benefits not paid by Medicare. The Secretary may establish an enrollment system for veterans to enroll in managed health care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. Cost-sharing requirements may include an enrollment premium, copayment charges, and deductibles. Payments received for care provided to veterans enrolled in the health-care plan shall be used to cover costs of care and services. The Secretary is prohibited from operating a plan in any fiscal year. The Secretary must ensure that sufficient medical care funds are allotted to a Department facility before operating a plan under subsection (a) of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. This is to provide needed hospital care and medical services to veterans described in section 1710(a)(1) during that fiscal year. The Secretary must ensure adequate medical care funds for a Department facility to provide hospital care and services to veterans in need during the fiscal year. A new item is added to the table of sections in Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. Establishment of managed health-care plans. Requirement for payment for certain services provided by Department facilities. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will make Medicare payments to Department managed health care plans for certain veterans who are Medicare-eligible individuals and enrolled in the plan under similar terms as payments to other managed care health plans under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will make Medicare payments to Department managed health care plans for Medicare-eligible veterans under similar terms as payments to other managed care health plans under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. Managed health care plans organized under section 1705 of this title providing care to Medicare-eligible veterans will be deemed certified Medicare Choice organizations. The Secretary will certify to the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will certify Department managed health care plans under section 1705 of this title as certified Medicare Choice organizations. The term 'Medicare-eligible veteran' refers to a veteran entitled to benefits under the Medicare program. The term 'Medicare-eligible veteran' means a veteran entitled to benefits under the Medicare program, and 'Medicare Choice organization' refers to a managed health care organization under part C of title XVIII of the Social Security Act. Section 1729A of title 38, United States Code, added by subsection (b), applies to care provided after the enactment of this Act.
